24576.name: Pompiers! A Vos Lances!
24576.description:
The building is on fire! Don't waste any time. Send your team of firefighters to the rescue! Cover the highest number of windows, balconies and doors in order to save the maximum number of people, animals and objects.
A game for ages 6 and up.

L'immeuble est en flamme ! Ne perdez pas de temps. Préparez votre équipe de pompiers pour entreprendre le sauvetage. Accédez au plus grand nombre de fenêtres, balcons et portes pour sauver de l'incendie le maximum de personnes, d'animaux et d'objets.
Pour les 6 ans et plus.

boardgamehonor.9273: 2005 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee

24577.name: Wiggle & Giggle
24577.description:
Wiggle & Giggle is the ball balancing physical game of fun, a challenging game of physical movement and balance.

Players try to earn the most points by balancing the foam balls and performing the tasks shown on the spinner. For example: Hold a ball between your knees - jump 3 times. While still holding this ball, balance another ball on your shoulder (you can use your chin to hold it in place). Now, bend over, place your hands on the ground and leap like a frog! Once a challenge has been successfully completed, a point card is earned, and it's the next player's turn to try a hilarious task.

For ages 4 and up.

24578.description:
This 47-card expansion for Nuclear War is packaged in 8-card booster packs (inspired by the success Magic: The Gathering).

The cards appear different numbers of times on the press sheet, giving different levels of "rarity", and the boosters are more or less random. They are packed in clear plastic, with a cover/proof of purchase card (40 of the proof of purchase cards can be sent in for a free Supergerm T-shirt).

The new cards are mostly Secrets (20) and Specials (19), with three new sizes of Propaganda, four new sizes of Warhead, and one new Delivery System.

To incorporate this expansion into an existing Nuclear War/Escalation/Proliferation deck while preserving the existing balance of card types and strengths requires using a bunch of the new Propaganda and Warhead cards; to preserve the proportion of delivery systems, you either have to use a lot of the Delta Clipper or scavenge some extra "regular" delivery systems (perhaps a use for the ads/jokers from Nuclear War, or some of the blanks available from Flying Buffalo).

Expands:

Nuclear War




Microbadge

Buy It
24578.name: Nuclear War Booster Packs

24579.name: Leap
24579.description: Rules are provided for five jumping and number games, four categories of jumping and number puzzles to play on the 6x6 grid. Activities with chess knights' moves and magic squares are especially interesting. A major section is devoted to Wade Philpott's "Leap Solitaire," cited in Oxford University Press' The Ins and Outs of Peg Solitaire. The 36 numbered pieces reverse to blank checkers.

24580.name: Dezign-8
24580.description: Chosen for the Games 100 list — one of the best games of 2001. This concept was created 40 years ago by an architect, Bill Briggs. The original tile patterns are expanded from four to the full eight. Every combination of 1, 2, 3 and 4 paths exiting from a square, with enough multiples in a strategic mix, allows the creation of the most intricate designs. All you have to do is match the paths. A strange fact — no matter how you connect the paths, the number of separate groups will always equal the number of closed loops formed. The laser-cut, hand-inlaid acrylic tiles are framed so the 14" set can be displayed on its easel as an ever-changing work of art.

24581.name: Boats
24581.description: This game set was designed and developed entirely by trans-Atlantic email between Mike Roberts and Kate Jones. The ideas and messages grew and flew feverishly for months, and at last stopped at 101 beautiful and challenging figures formed by matching the boat-shaped tiles by color. The 36 tiles comprise all the ways 6 colors can be paired. Here's a sample tile. The 13 islands in the 11" tray are fixed in place. Outside the tray 100 other exquisite lattices await. Several competitive games are included.

24582.name: Poly-5
24582.description: Nominated for the Games 100, All the shapes of 1 through 5 squares in size (polyominoes orders 1 through 5) fill a 6" tray. The multi-colored laser cut acrylic pieces serve for six games and hundreds of other puzzle shapes, as shown in the included 52-page handbook.

24583.description: 36 acrylic pieces include all the shapes of 6 squares joined ("hexominoes"). Each piece has a name. They are sized to be compatible with Poly-5, making it combinable with that set. The 8½" tray and vinyl game mat accommodate four strategic games and hundreds of puzzles. A Games 100 nominee.
24583.name: Sextillions

24584.name: Cube Brick
24584.description: On Games 100 list for 2003. Fifteen unique color-patterned cubes: drawing on 6 colors, each cube has a unique combination of 4 colors on its 2x2 faces. Each cube face has a different arrangement of its four colors. So there are 90 all-different faces. A wealth of figures to solve by matching the cube edges, plus super challenges of 3-D shapes with non-matched solutions. Games for beginners and experts are included.

24586.name: Post-Time: A Horse Racing Game of Chance
24586.description: A game of horse racing where players are attempting to amass the greatest amount of money.

24587.name: Horsemen
24587.description: Game about harness racing where players are trying to amass money by purchasing and then racing horses.

24588.name: Las Vegas
24588.description:
This game is like Roulette with dice. Each turn, 3 dice of different colors are thrown and before that, 2-3 players can bet on the outcome of this dice throw.

The board is showing all possible bets for all 3 dice colors, from Even, Uneven, Lower, Higher and so on.
Each player starts with 20 chips of a chosen color and he must try to be the first who wins all 108 chips of that color.

24589.name: Hexago
24589.description:
Hexago from Hexagames is played on a purple hex gameboard with about 300 hex spaces.

It's kind of Go-Moku, but you must get 6 stones in a row here. The colors of the pieces are green, orange and purple, which it not the best choice, since the purple stones on the purple board are much harder to see than the others.

24590.name: Sag nix über Pulok
24590.description:
2-4 players get a score board where the game title "Sag nix über Pulok" (=don't tell anything about Pulok) is written 6 times. This sentence contents of 15 different letters, which is important for the game.

Each player gets 15 out of 195 letter-tiles at the beginning and he has the possibility to exchange 1 of them every turn. Object of the game is to place 15 letters on the score board, which must be done with certain rules. The first player reaching this is given an extra bonus, but the winner will be determined by counting the points for the laid out tiles of each player.

The game comes with 15 funny jokers and 4 large cardboard screens (to hide the letter-tiles behind) with amusing motifs.

24591.name: Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse
24591.description:
"Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse" (The Great British Train Robbery) is a game about the famous English train robbery in 1963.

Each player must pick up mailbags at certain places of the board and bring them to 3 hideouts on the board. There are several obstacles to fulfill this: Scotland Yard can confiscate the bags for example and a player must pay kind of bribe while carrying a postbag. Earning money can be done with buying farms and these farms can also protect a player while staying there.

The game ends, when all mailbags are taken off the train. The player, who could bring the most mailbags to the hideouts is the winner.

24592.description: Victory in Harness Racing is determined mainly by skill and strategy . YOU are the driver, maneuvering for position. YOU control your horse and sulky, blocking other player's horses. As the field sweeps around the final turn into the homestretch, YOU go all out in a pulse-pounding rush for the finish line.
24592.name: Home Stretch Harness Racing Game

24593.name: Minoru
24593.description:
Minoru is a British horse racing game manufactured by John Jacques. The five horses are die cast metal painted in different colors to designate racing teams. The large playing surface is folded felt.

Named for King Edward VII's Epsom Derby-winning Irish thoroughbred racehorse, Minoru, the game Minoru was a popular parlor game, kept available in the lounge of hotels and clubs as well as in homes between the world wars.

24594.name: Hot Rod: The Sport Car Race
24594.description: A very simple race game played on a roll out mat. While the playing pieces are nice, the most impressive piece of equipment is the massive upright, roulette wheel style spinner.

24595.name: Hold Your Horses
24595.description: Any number of people can play this simple racing game that uses a deck of cards to determine movement of five horses.

24596.name: Zoo
24596.description: Zoo: Card Game. Cards represent various animals with up to 12 traits. Players play melds of cards with the same trait. Players score victory points for having the highest score in a trait. Good Kids Game. Complete rules plus link to card set at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Zoo.html

24597.name: Giant Wheel Thrills 'n' Spills Horse Race Game
24597.description: A steeplechase game played on a roll out map. The centerpiece of the game is the giant, roulette wheel style, upright spinner that is used to determine movement.

24598.name: Granat
24598.description:
Granat (=garnet) is played on a 9 x 7.5 grid board and both players have an army of 14 pieces and 2 "Granat"-balls. Each wooden playing piece has a crater-shaped top, which enables to hold one of the metallic granat balls.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces. Normal pieces can move 1 grid, but pieces holding a granat ball can move as far as they want. The granat ball can easily be displaced in your half of the board, but on the opposing half, you can only move it to an adjacent piece.

24599.name: Horse Wise
24599.description: Players answer horsemanship questions as they move their horses around the show ring, first to the right, then to the left. Players use their knowledge of horsemanship topics to advance to the finish square and win ribbons.

24600.description:
This a modern reproduction of a vintage game.

Players line up their horses on a three foot track and crank a handle that vibrates the board. This in turn causes the horses to move down the track. There are slits in the track that act as obstacles to possibly slow down the horses. The first horse across the finish line is the winner.
24600.name: Neck and Neck

24601.name: Show Jumping Trials
24601.description:
Show Jumping Trials is a unique board game where players try to complete the course over the fences, jumps, and water jump, against the timer using an 8 sided die and a 6 sided die. When they have mastered that, they then try to complete the course while picking up the fewest faults.

The basic gameboard is a 12x12 grid.

24602.description: Sheep-dog Trials is a compact and unique little boardgame (using a 12x12 grid playing area) where players are competing with each other and a timer. Each player attempts to round up as many sheep as possible against the clock - whilst the sheep attempt to keep out of the dog's reach. The sheep can jump the fences but the dog must go through the gate! Then the roles are reversed!
24602.name: Sheep-dog Trials

24603.name: Yachting
24603.description: YACHTING is colorful, easy to understand and easy to play, suitable for players aged 5 and up, where players players pick a Yacht and using only a wind direction dice, they must attempt to navigate out of the harbor and round the course, from buoys 1 to 6, and back to the harbor.

24604.description: Fairies and Rainbows is a simple but enjoyable game for anyone who loves fairies. Try to collect the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, but watch out for the goblins!
24604.name: Fairies and Rainbows

24605.name: Teddy Bear and Friends
24605.description: Teddy Bear and Friends, 100 years after the creation of the first Teddy Bear comes a new game from Shannon Boardgames that celebrates their favorite pastime, picnics! The object of the game is to try and collect the perfect picnic. Beware though as you must always keep your eye on your hamper as other Players attempt to steal your collection. "Teddy Bear and Friends" is a game that will delight both children and adults alike.

24606.name: Dribble
24606.description:
DRIBBLE is intended for people aged 5 years old and upwards, and is fun and easy to play.Played with 2 dice and a timer for half time and full time, two players compete against each other to score as many goals as possible.

Throw-ins, Corner Kicks, are all possible and the games quick format lends itself to tournament playing amongst friends.

There is also a customized edition for the Rangers Football Club.

24607.description:
I Spy! is a unique travel board game that can be enjoyed by anyone to while away the journey. The game is fun and easy to play. Players have to remain focused on the game and their surroundings to win. The unique game format ensures that your surroundings and your concentration (and a bit of luck!) will decide the winner.

If you want a bit of peace and quiet on your journey -- stay at home. But if you want to make the journey more bearable, then this is the game for you!
24607.name: I-Spy

24608.description: "Howzat!" is a must have board game for all lovers of the sport of cricket! Roll the dice and make your shot. Try to out-do your opponent in this game of wits and strategy. Will you make a century or be out for a duck? If it's not "Howzat!" then it just isn't cricket!
24608.name: Howzat!

24609.name: Planetarium
24609.description: "Planetarium" is a beautifully illustrated game based on the night sky, where players have to move around the board trying to connect a string of colored constellations before their opponents do.

24610.description: In each pack are sixty cards forming ten stunning images of Scottish Highlanders in full regalia with the Clan Tartan, Clan Crest and each Highlander complete with a brief history of their Clan. This gift can be played as a game (and it's quite a challenge!) or simply be pieced together for your visual enjoyment.
24610.name: Clans and Tartans of Scotland

24611.name: Property Tycoon
24611.description: In Property Tycoon, players move around the board and buy property using a hidden bid system. Players do not know who they are bidding against — if anyone — as only one player has to reveal intent. You can be financially ruined and out of the game before you even start on the property ladder.

24612.name: Crazy Circles
24612.description: Crazy Circles is a colorful game for 5 year olds and upwards. It is very easy to play but very frustrating. You simply have to get from the start to the finish -- easy? There is no skill required for this game -- just a lot of luck and a desire to have some fun.

24613.name: Burns and Verse
24613.description: Burns and Verse comprises 10 beautiful images of the great poet Robert Burns and/or associates complemented with a wonderful verse. Burns and Verse can be enjoyed as a game amongst friends, or pieced together by lovers of Burns poetry.

24614.name: Alley Cat
24614.description: Alley Cat is a game for cat lovers of all ages. Take on the role of a domestic house cat and try to collect the various items that have been scattered over the rooms of the house. Beware of the dog!

24615.name: Vampire Requiem
24615.description: Battle it out with Vampires, beasts, demons and even humans to try and establish dominance over your foes in this unique and superbly illustrated card game.

24616.name: Morgan junior: The Race is on
24616.description: Based loosely on Shannon Boardgames previous game of paying attention while traveling -- I-Spy. Players are trying to be the first to make it past the finish line.

24617.name: Nessie: An Aquatic Adventure
24617.description: Nessie - An Aquatic Adventure was designed for the Loch Ness 2000 exhibition based on the shores of Loch Ness near Urquhart Castle.

24618.name: Scamp
24618.description: "Scamp" is a game about Guide Dogs created specially for the "Guide Dogs for the Blind" association. The object is to make it from your home to the park whilst keeping your guide dog by your side.

24619.name: Falkirk Wheel
24619.description: "The Falkirk Wheel" is a game commissioned by "British Waterways Scotland" to be sold in the gift shop housed in the Falkirk Wheel complex, which was opened in 2002. This is a simple game mimicking the wheel's rotational movement.

24620.name: Bottoms Up
24620.description:
From Box
"A classic game played on a checker board and combining some of the choice aspects of chess, droughts, poker and bridge. yet so easy to learn everyone achieves competence sufficient for enjoyment during the first game. Accommodates 2,3 or 4 players
at once."

The object of the game is to accumulate the highest score, which is not necessarily the same as capturing all of one's opponent's pieces.

Moves: Any counter or piece may be moved exactly like a chess queen however limited to the number of squares moved at a single turn by the number on its bottom. that is a counter may be moved perpendicular to the sides of the squares or along the diagonals provided there is no obstruction but limited by the number on the bottom.
General Rule: Any piece moved more than one square on a single turn of a player must be turned and played bottom up for the remainder of the game .... capture is the same as in chess .... a players score is the sum of the numbers on the bottoms of the opposing pieces he/she has captured plus the sum of the numbers on his/her own counters remaining on the board at end.
etc etc

24621.name: Pago Pago
24621.description:
"There's never been anything like this crossword puzzle game!" That seems likely...

The game consists of three large sheets of paper, with each four different crossword puzzles on each side of each sheet. Two to four (as two teams) players work the puzzle on their side of the square sheet for three minutes, each with their own colored pencil. When time is up, the sheet is rotated 90 degrees, the timer is reset, and the players work the new (to them) puzzle now on their side.

You keep adding letters and/or correcting mistakes, then rotating every three minutes until the puzzles are completed or everyone gives up. You get points for correct letters you've added, and you subtract points for errors noted by your opponents. The colored pencils allow end-of-game scoring and adjudication of the puzzles. Answers are provided in sealed envelopes.

Seems like it would be fun, but you'd really have to love crosswords - working them with time pressure is sweet misery. Six games can be played by four players with the supplied puzzles. Refill puzzles were available in 1985 using the handy order form, but good luck now.

24622.name: Flip-It Twenty One
24622.description:
Featuring Flip Wilson on the cover, the object of this game is to be the first to reach 21 without going over (ala Blackjack).
Played like regular Blackjack, each player receives one hand card and shoots for their other cards using the spring-loaded ball to hit a blue plastic ball around the roulette-like board. Once a card has been rolled the player marks it with one of the small embossed plastic markers.

24623.name: Flip-It 7-11
24623.description:
A dice game that features a disc shooting mechanism to generate dice rolls. The game board also supports play as a standard craps table.
The game features Flip Wilson on the cover.

24624.name: The Historic Mackinac Island Game
24624.description: Players roll dice and move around the board gaining colors by marking their score sheets with the color of the space they land on (each depicting the name of a Mackinac Island merchant.) When a player collects 7 of any color, he moves to one of two dock spaces. From there, players attempt to roll specific combinations in order to advance to the island and collect a Historic card, and then return back to start. Historic cards are worth 75-150 points. First one to 500 points wins.

24626.name: East Front
24626.description:
East Front is a simulation on a Corps/Army level of the Russo-German war of 1941-1945. The game covers the entire war from the Axis invasion of Russia to the final destruction of the Axis armies four years later. In addition to the campaign game, there are scenarios covering the invasion of Poland, yearly scenarios for Operation Barbarossa, Stalingrad, Kursk and the Destruction of Army Group Center and a smaller, German High Water scenario cover the period from November 1942 - Jan 1943. The game is unique in that it uses hexagonal shaped counters instead of the standard square counters.

800 counters (2 sets of 2 counter sheets)

24627.description: "Ship-to-ship game play, and powerful star fleets at your command! Build your fleet, challenge your friends, and conquer the galaxy. Assemble star fighters, transports, and capital ships from across the Star Wars saga into unstoppable armadas! Pit fleet against fleet in fast, head-to-head combat involving maneuverable starships and massive weapon platforms! Will the forces of the dark side crush the galaxy, or will the champions of the light side prevail? The fate of worlds rests in your hands!"
24627.name: Star Wars Miniatures: Starship Battles

24628.description: Be the "Top Bun" with this fast paced card game! Build a burger with cards and add the right sides.
24628.name: Burgermeister!

24629.name: Serenity: The Unofficial Board Game
24629.description:
From the creator of the game:

"I made up a game based on Firefly and Serenity, in which you fly around the 'verse looking for work and trying to put together a crew."

"You try not to get pirated by other players, avoid the Reavers and Alliance, and try to earn credits. "

There is a preview here: http://www.fireflyfans.net/sunroomitem.asp?i=10704

Game can be downloaded here: http://docs.google.com/leaf?id=0Bz_OJBPpg5bKNWMyOTMyMzktMmNm...;hl=en

Home Page: http://www.coroflot.com/micjwelch

24630.name: Forino
24630.description:
Something is happening in the cheese! The mice are very hungry and are very keen on tasty cheese. Through the holes at the sides and in the top of the cheese the children try to catch themselves the pieces of cheese that are stuck to the magnets.

But beware - those who get caught by a cat lose a turn!

(For Ages 3+)

24631.name: Seebär, ahoi
24631.description:
Four sailing ships are docked in the port. The little sea dogs have to skillfully use their colored sails in order to be the first to reach the mysterious rainbow island. One by one, in a clockwise direction, the players each pull a sail out of the sailor's kit bag: the boat onto which a colored sail is stuck moves ahead to the next free square of the same color as the sail. As there can only be one sail of each color on the masts of the boats, the sails sometimes have to be stuck on the boats of others players. Watch out: If a black sail is stuck on a boat, it has to move backwards. The sea dog who brings their boat into the bay of the rainbow island first wins the game.

Ages 4 and up.

24632.name: Cross'n GO
24632.description:
from the publisher

This game is built on a mobile checker board, which you composed differently at the beginning of each game. The player can only move forward on the road of his color; he has to move the bars of the checker board to proceed by following the points to move the bars. Your stake will be always TO CHOOSE between building your road or putting barriers on the road of your opponent, or even, destroy this road… Your behaviors will have to be well-balanced: “too nice” and you will be blinded and immobilized, “too nasty” and you will have to face the unforeseen obstacles raised by your opponent and also by yourself.

24633.description:
A set of miniatures rules for Tanks skirmish level historical wargaming (1 stand = 1 tank, 1 stand = squad/ldr/weapon team)

Movement is simultaneous.

Fire Order is determined by assigning units to cards and shuffling the deck and turning over the card.
Fire order is then enhanced by an initiative roll.
Contains lots of ratings for weapons/vehicles from WW2 through the mid-80's
24633.name: Armored Attack: 1939 to 1990

24634.name: The Game of Wisdom
24634.description:
The basis of the game is to convince a JUDGE and collect LAURELS. You roll the die, move one of your tokens and draw a card corresponding to the color you landed on. The JUDGE gives 15 seconds (timer not included) for anyone else who would like THE RIGHT TO SPEAK to indicate they would like to answer. After the time has elapsed the JUDGE rereads the question back to the original player, the payer has 30 seconds to answer and reason (Yes/No is not sufficient). There is CRITERIA to determine if the answer is acceptable. The JUDGE, regardless of if the answer is to their taste, awards a LAUREL to any answer that meets criteria. A player may CHALLENGE a ruling and risk losing two LAURELS. Anyone else who has asked for THE RIGHT TO SPEAK may provide their answer. If they REPEAT what the first answer was, they lose a LAUREL. If they also provide a satisfactory answer, they receive a LAUREL. After a player has answered one of each coloured card and has 12 LAURELS they may predict even or odd on their turn and finish PHASE 1

For PHASE 2

As the player CLIMBS THE LADDER OF WISDOM in phase two, they must always contribute an answer on another players turn by using the RIGHT TO SPEAK TOKEN. As well, on their turn they must Guess EVEN/ODD before rolling. Being unable to answer or failing to contribute costs five LAURELS or go down a rung. Once at the top there is a final guess of EVEN / ODD to be declared THE GREAT THINKER.

24635.name: Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego
24635.description:
Description from the box:

THE MYSTERY HISTORY GAME

Carmen is hiding somewhere in time - your mission is to check each century on the game board until you find her.

Along the way, you'll race to put historical events in their correct order. Then, match stolen loot to its correct century. Is Paul Revere's horse from the 18th century or the 17th? Did it appear before or after Pocahontas saved Captain John Smith? You'll find out as you track Carmen in this exciting game that brings history to life.

24636.name: Wild Rush
24636.description: A Japanese game from the makers of R-Eco. Wild Rush is aptly named, as players fling cards into a center receptacle which is cleverly put together from a folded-up design. The first player to get rid of their cards wins, but there are rules about which cards can be tossed and when.

24637.name: Wir Gehören Zusammen!
24637.description: A fun children's game about how to properly deal with dogs. The game includes a set of colorful cards depicting situations that a child could encounter with dogs, such as two dogs fighting, etc. The player must then play a card which shows the proper response to the action. There are cards that show both right and wrong reactions.

24638.name: Sandwiching Game
24638.description: The full name of this game is the "Addition, Multiplication, Calculation Sandwiching Game". The board is two sided and each side shows a 9 x 9 grid. One side is for addition and the other for multiplication. Players place pieces on the grid and try to roll combinations that will remove other players' pegs. A Japan Brain Sports Association winner.

24639.name: Zoned
24639.description: A wooden game with a very limited print run. The pieces in the game are a single square attached to a triangle with a base twice the size of the square side (like a house with a full roof but only one half below). Similar to 1 Stein + Co, pieces are placed on a grid with the goal of blocking off territory. Cubes are placed in the closed in spaces and the player who can place most of their cubes wins.

24640.name: Trio Trio
24640.description: A wooden abstract where players use multi-colored stones and try to create sets of three through clever movement.

24641.name: Lincoln's War

boardgamefamily.6265: RFCM: Rule For The Common Man

24641.description:
Lincoln's War uses the same grid based system as the "Square Bashing" World War One rules, where the play surface is subdivided into 1 foot (30 cm) squares. Units advance from square to square coming into conflict when they wish to advance into one of the opponent's square.

The game is designed for a 6' x 4' table. Terrain is abstracted; the individual squares are rated as open (little or no terrain) and closed (terrain that encumbers movement such as woods or towns). Because figures are simply moved from one large square to another, basing standards are very relaxed; units can be based in almost any fashion and both sides need not be identical.

The game system includes rules for off-table effects such as cavalry scouting, supply and shortening/lengthening the scenario.

The scale is as follows:

Infantry regiments are 3-5 bases.
Artillery batteries are 1 base.
Cavalry regiments are 3-4 bases.

Individual squares can hold up to 10 units of infantry or cavalry or 5 units of artillery.

24643.description:
From the back cover:

Here they are... the AADA's choice for the meanest vehicle designs of the year. From Division 5 to Division 100+, they're fully armed, completely described and ready to go.
This book brings you 78 brand-new designs, all compatible with the Car Wars Compendium rules and legal for AADA World Championship competition. From cycles to campers, from the tough little Fire Imp to the monstrous Polaris, every one is a highway warrior's dream.

And every one of these 78 new vehicles is represented by four counters, included with this book... a full color vehicle, a full color wreck, and black-and-white versions of both the new and wrecked car, to let you fly your own colors in the arena.
So fasten your seat belt, check out all vehicle systems, and hit the road for more Car Wars action. And never forget... no matter where you go... drive offensively!

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars Compendium
24643.name: Car Wars Supplement, The AADA Vehicle Guide: Volume 3

24644.description:
Square Bashing 1914-1918 is a very different concept from most miniatures rules, which makes it almost a hybrid between miniatures and boardgames. The playing surface (usually 6'x4') is subdivided into 12" squares. Each square is designated as open (minimal movement impediment) or closed (serious impediment). Players build up their forces in a square and assault adjacent squares in an attempt to capture them

Because figures simply occupy a square, there is no need for strict basing sizes. In fact, unlike most miniatures games, there is no adverse effect for having a variety of basing sizes.

Note: modifications for Russian Civil War and East Africa battles are also included.

Scale:

Infantry battalions: 4 bases
Artillery battery: 1-2 bases
Cavalry regiment: 4 bases
Armored car squadron: 2 models
Tank units: 1 model
Machine gun company: 1 base
Lorry transport unit: 2 models
Brigade/Division HQ: 1 base

Squares can hold up to 12 infantry/cavalry units, artillery bases, or tank bases.

Expanded by:

Proletarians, To Horse!
24644.name: Square Bashing 1914-1918

boardgamefamily.6265: RFCM: Rule For The Common Man

24645.name: Hindu Windu
24645.description: Hindu Windu is a beer and pretzels game about fakirs racing on their carpets. You can win the game in 2 ways - by getting to the goal line first, or by being the last one left alive. To stop his opponents each fakir can either fight, or use magic spells.

24646.name: Rhino!
24646.description: A game with beautiful wooden Rhinos that uses the same ideas as Wittigs' Mary Pennylane and Raina. Players try to pull the Rhinos toward a goal using a die that determines which rope can be held. The Rhino is pulled until caught.

24647.description:
The game represents whale hunting in the village of Ozette (a prehistoric settlement on the American West Coast which was buried in a mudslide around 1500 A.D. and excavated in the 20th century).

The game mat depicts a whale. Prey stones are placed on the ribs. Players spin an unusual spintop, resulting in 1-3 red and 1-3 blue arrows pointing up. Depending on the number of red arrows, players move their playing pieces from rib to rib and collect prey stones, but only if the hunting stone is showing the whale. The hunting stone can be flipped instead of moving. When all prey has been collected, the player with most prey wins. However, if three blue arrows show six times during the game, the whale wins and the player loses. Depending on which arrow they spin the spintop with, players can influence the outcome of their spin.
24647.name: Ozette

24648.name: Mercator
24648.description: Mercator is a business and trading game for 2 to 6 players. The board is a copy of the map of the world of the geographer Strabon (60 B.C. - 25 A.D.) and encloses the Orbis Romanum (the Roman world) which agrees historically with the Roman empire in the first and second century. The game uses ideas ahead of its time for trading, development, land management, and political maneuvering.

24649.name: Desert Dice
24649.description: A unique dice dexterity game that uses a large wooden frame holding real sand. Dice of various sizes are buried in the sand, and players use magnetic rods to pull up dice of specific values to score points.

24650.name: Regenbogen
24650.description: Regenbogen (Rainbow) is a large box filled with cards of many colors. With these cards, players build structures to score points. The taller, more complex, and more colors used, the more the points.

24651.name: Vectorace
24651.description:
From the instructions:
Four races of beings from different areas of the galaxy are faced with extinction. They are each involved in the desperate search for a new solar system.
The elders of each race have summoned their top space pilots to head the mission to secure their new home.
Each player takes on one of these journeys into space in the hope of being the first to guarantee survival.
"Only one race can survive".

The board represents a galaxy which consists of 16 solar systems - four dying and twelve unexplored. The gameboard is laminated so that the planet counters, made of shiny flexible plastic, can adhere to the board during play, but are easily peeled off and re-positioned. It has a 70 sci-fi look, and ‘3d’ energy recording strips which are exchanged when alliances are formed.
Interlocking ships are used to move round the board to colonize planets, gain energy points and split apart for combat. Movement is by dice, though players can elect to slow the ship down by using energy points, to enable them to reach specific target squares. Hyperspace Gates can also be used to perform more complex moves. Combat is resolved by a highest dice wins system. An Asteroid belt finalizes a range of encounters, from combat to entering an occupied square. There are also rules for alliances and planet hopping.

24652.name: Flag To Flag Racing

5736.name: Flag To Flag Racing Game Inc.

boardgameversion.179608: Flag To Flag Racing Game Inc. Edition

24652.description:
A very straight-forward racing game. Players roll dice to move their cars around a track separated into spaces. Some spaces are cautions, at which a caution card is drawn. Players gain and lose money throughout the race and receive bonus money based on finishing positions. Multiple races can be played. The player with the most money at the end wins the game.

Components include board, custom money, caution cards, dice and playing piece cars.

The game looks to be self-published, with the box stating "Limited 1st Edition," and the rules stating that "You have purchased one of the original 2500 games produced." I doubt that there was a second run.

Rules also state: "Copyright No. VA249-950 Flag To Flag Racing Game. September 21, 1992" and "Made in North Carolina U.S.A."

24653.description:
Picture Bingo is a perception game for 1-3 children. A leader should be chosen before each game. The leader selects one picture tile after the other and says its name out loud. If a player finds that tile on their picture board they get to keep that tile and place it on their board. The first player to fill their picture board wins.

Source: Amazon.com
24653.name: Picture Bingo

24654.name: Numero
24654.description: A tile matching game to learn to count. Learn amounts and numbers from one to ten.

boardgamehonor.12465: 2004 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee

24655.name: Plumino
24655.description: Mathematical brains, this is for you! With correct addition or subtraction, you can exchange your game pieces on the flower. Exciting reckoning using 1-10 made easy.

24656.name: Piccobello
24656.description: There is a washing basket full of sparkling clean wash, waiting to be hung out to dry for each player. The trouble is, they can only hang out the item whose color is shown by the dice. Typical, though, the weather doesn't always do what it should. The wash only dries properly when it is sunny and windy. If it rains, the wash must be taken down and put in the basket again.

boardgamehonor.19516: 2004 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee

24657.description: "Oh no, the vet is due a visit! We'd better run away." The cow, horse, dog, and other animals need their check-up to make sure they get through winter safely. Help the farmer to catch his stray animals. An exciting dice game that is cunning, tricky, and needing a little bit of luck. The winner is the player with four stamps in his health certificate.
24657.name: Venga-Venga

24658.description:
A river flows into the big sea in Avanti mare!. At one end of the river, a fishing boat starts moving downstream toward the sea that awaits at the end. Halfway to the sea, four fish are playing in the water – but once that boat starts to move, the fish will flee to the safety of the open water. Will they get away, or end up in a net?

Players can decide to back either the fish or the fishermen, but the winners will be determined by the die rolls. On a turn, the player rolls the colored die. If the player rolls one of the two colors assigned to the boat, he removes one of the river segments, thereby moving the boat closer to the fish; if one of the fish colors is rolled, that fish moves one space closer to the sea. If the boat moves onto a fish, it catches that fish; if a fish reaches the sea, it escapes and can't be captured. The game ends when all the fish escape or are caught. Which side will come out on top?
24658.name: Avanti mare!

24659.name: Tunelino
24659.description: The travelers on the train are going on a long journey today. First of all, the train must be hooked together. The reward for being a successful engineer is to ride through the tunnel.

24660.description: Six popular pets are in the middle of the table as cards. The same six pets are on the sides of the four dice. Who will be the first to find the animals shown by the dice? Players have to react quick as a flash and grab the right cards!
24660.name: Catch the Animals

24661.name: Colorful Ottokar
24661.description: Each player tries to be the first to thread his disks onto Ottokar the Octopus. The one who does this most quickly wins.

24662.name: Loco-Motifs
24662.description: Real railway tracks emerge from each of the eight-track cards when the correct motifs on the reverse side are uncovered. Which locomotive will be the first to the finish and ring the winner's bell?

24663.name: Fädelmaus
24663.description: The children are excited -- a mouse darts through the nursery and the garden. It has already slipped through seven holes -- who can best thread the mouse's path?

24664.description:
To sleep peacefully, each dwarf needs its own matching pillow. But a pillow pincher causes unrest by stealing pillows again and again. With a bit of luck on the dice, one can take the pillows back from the pincher and cover up his dwarf.

Ages 3 and up.
24664.name: Pillow Pincher

24665.name: Fädelraupe
24665.description:
The caterpillar grows with each little disk. Thread correctly, and learn to distinguish colors while playing.

Ages 3 and up.

boardgamehonor.19627: 2002 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee

24666.name: Greif zu!
24666.description: The aim of this game is to snatch the wooden picture tiles which correspond the pictures on the dice as quickly as possible. The player with the most wooden tiles at the end is the winner.

24667.name: Fantasto
24667.description: Feeling, touching, and finding the right colors: who will fetch the right token out of the little pouch? The tokens have to be plugged into the picture board matching both is size and color.

24668.name: Scolina
24668.description: An entertaining learning game with a built-in key to check the solutions to problems. Learning by playing is fun: find the pairs, sort the shapes and colors, and put things in order.

24669.description:
The baby animals make the most of the lovely weather by going on an outing in the forest. Some of the little animals play hide and seek. See if you can find out who is missing! Nominated for Kinder Spiel des Jahres in 2003.

To play you take the 16 animal tiles and set 3 aside. You then flip through the remaining tiles, calling out their names or making the animal sounds for extra fun. Then mark on your score board which animals were set aside. It's a memory game, so your kids will beat you handily.

Includes 16 sturdy cardboard animal tiles, 4 wooden scoreboards and 12 wooden marking disks.
24669.name: Sparito!

24670.name: Popsicle Zone Games
24670.description: Three games in one. Game one: the coolest hoppin' Popsicle party ever! Collect the most Popsicles. Game two: The Popsicle 500 race game. Get in gear and hurry around the game board. Game three: Popsicle or President? To win the election, get out there and collect votes!

24671.name: Ein Mops kommt selten allein!
24671.description: Four pugs go to eat, but one is not who they seem! Dash as quickly as possible to the food but be careful to get enough to eat else lose your place.

24672.name: Colorloc
24672.description:
From the rule sheet:

Colorloc is a game for 2 players. Each player has 23 pieces. The pieces are of three types: colored, grey or plain. Each player has 16 colored pieces, 6 grey pieces and 1 plain piece. Whites plain piece is solid white. Blacks plain piece is solid black.

The object of the game is to capture your opponents plain (target) piece.

The basic premise of the game is that a colored piece is locked into lines of it's own color and the black lines. Each piece has it's own special rules to follow in addition to this. Grey pieces can move on any line, and the grey 'dot' pieces are particularly powerful..

24673.name: Trigammon
24673.description:
Backgammon for 2 to 6!

In a 3 player game: Each player has 15 “stones”. These stones are played from the slots and are brought onto the “Bear In Table” according to dice rolls.

The object of Trigammon is to move your stones from the slots to the “Bear In Table” then around the game board to the “Bear Out Table” and then off before your opponents can.

There are variations for 2 to 6 players.

24674.name: It's a Knockout
24674.description:
Based on the hit BBC television program of the same name, 'It's a Knockout', versions of which ran concurrently in countries across Europe. Contestants competed in silly obstacle course type games, usually wearing equally silly costumes. Regional heats culminated in the winners representing their countries in international contests known as "Jeux Sans Frontières" (Games Without Frontiers). The board game was originally created in Britain in 1974 and became the Australian Toy Association's game of the year in 1986.

Players move around a playing board until they land on one of the 'games' that include variants on tiddlywinks, target shooting, blow football and bowling. The position that players finish in the sub-games determines the amount of points that they receive. Each player has a "joker" that can be played before any one game and they get double points for that game.

The player with the highest number of points wins.

The game is designed for children, but is enjoyable when played by adults that remember the television program.

24676.name: Sterneföifi
24676.description: A planetarium-themed game where players must identify constellations and other sky objects. The game includes 9 different start disks and components to make it competitive.

24679.name: Atrio
24679.description:
Atrio is played on an octagon with 3 marbles per player. Pieces are pushed away by playing a dark marble. The first player who gets his marbles in the inner circle or who ousts one of the opponent's marbles off the board (beyond the large circle) wins

Atrio was designed by Christian Gibon (France) and first published in 1997 by LM Créations.

Rules: http://maisonauteursdejeu.free.fr/Site.MAJ/LesJeux/ATRIO/Pre...

24681.name: Die Sonnenflieger
24681.description: The sun stands in the center of the board surrounded by the universe. Each player tries to reach the sun in order to obtain eternal life! The goal of the game is to become old and to live out a happy life. Players reach the sun using basic elements like air, fire, and and water, and the more trips made the higher the score.

24682.name: Kopf an Kopf
24682.description: An eye feast for the culturally interested. The game idea is traditional memory matching. The 80 cards show costumes as well as photos of statues, sculptures and paintings. Beautiful, fascinating photos of different time epochs come from the Rietberg Museum in Zurich. An accompanying booklet gives information about all of the photos.

24683.name: Buurejahr
24683.description: Two pleasant cube games. For gamers: Manage the farm most efficiently to make the most money. For children: Cultivate, harvest, and experience seasons and play the activities on the farm as a Cooperative game with many rewards in between.

24684.name: Mindstalkers
24684.description:
From their website

Mindstalkers is a skirmish wargame. The game starts in the distant future of mankind, but the actual action will be set in various historical ages.

The first line of miniatures and rule sets (in production right now and named "Mission: Middle Ages") regards the Italian Middle Ages (14th - 15th centuries). The following rule sets will be created according to the preferences of players themselves. New rules will be introduced for different historical ages: from the naval battles between pirates, to remote future wars, passing through barbarian invasions and the two World Wars... all will be possible!

The core rule set is based on fantasy/science fiction, but the game system allows the use of two different levels of rules.

The first one is purely historical, no fantasy or sci-fi elements, designed to play a true historical skirmish wargame: rules, equipment and characters are all strictly based on the referenced age. The second level provides special rules for fantasy elements (like psionic powers), according to the plot of Mindstalkers and adding unforeseeable features and fun to the skirmishes, but always keeping the fighting realism high.

24685.name: Tempora
24685.description: Tempora is a game about moving through different times. How have people experienced different cultures and lives during different times? "You have the clocks, we have the time": this African sentence was made at the address of Europeans and this inspired the game. A game with clocks and beautiful pictures from all over the world.

24686.name: Das Bus Spiel
24686.description: A game with large wooden pieces representing buses. The game is played on the floor. The "board" is the whole room. The buses go from stop to stop, and the winner is the player who can first deliver three multi colored passengers to their destination.

24687.name: Trollig
24687.description: The trolls have robbed the king's treasure and are holding it under a spell. Whoever uses his skill to strike the stone tiles with the magic stick can flip them face up and reveal a part of the valuable treasure. But watch out: if a Troll appears on a tile the magic in your stick is lost and your turn ends!

24688.name: Kuller Spass
24688.description:
The animals are hungry and are anxious to be fed with the fruits of the magic tree. But be careful: Only the one who shows some skill in this marble game will be able to hit the right fruits with the rolling ball and thus put aside his cards. Two game variants with different degrees of difficulty.

Ages 5 and up.

24689.name: Wer Machts Wie
24689.description: This game, which translates as "Who Does it How?", is the very evil twin to the Zoch game Who Lives Where. Like its child-game brother, this game includes very nicely carved small houses with animals laser cut from their bases. The trick in this game, however, is that instead of friendly crocodiles, pigs, and others trying to find the right home, this game is all about pigs in a variety of "romantic" positions. Some will make you blush, others are down-right X-rated. The Zoch team at Essen chuckle at this game and say that is a favorite gift for wedding showers.

24690.name: Golden Trivia
24690.description:
The game consists of 999 Question & Answer cards with 5 questions on each card. Upon each card are 5 dice symbols (1 dot through 5 dots.)

A roll of the die determines which question will be asked (by the player to the right of the answerer). If the answerer fails to answer the question, the question is passed to the player to the left and so on but excluding the questioner.

On a roll of 6, the player misses their turn. On a correct answer, the answerer earns points and the turn is over.

Players play to an agreed upon score.

The game also features a gang-up on the leader mechanic, potentially prolonging the torture for everyone. :)

24691.name: Whales
24691.description:
Whales is a two player (or two team) game with a very simple dice rolling mechanic. Players will either play on the Toothed (red) whale team or the Baleen (yellow) whale team.

The playing board shows eight whales, four of each type. Upon the whales are several circles, with numbers ranging from 2 to 12 (2d6 possibilities). The teams take turns rolling two dice and placing red or yellow colored 'barnacles' upon available circles. On dice rolls of 5 or 10, the Special Cards deck is used. On dice rolls of doubles, another turn is taken.

The Special Cards deck contains cards with educational information on whales and an action, such as placing a barnacle in an available circle on one of your whales.

The round ends when one team has filled all four of their whales with barnacles. Points, bonuses and penalties are scored, then another round is begun. The game is played in several rounds until one side has scored the desired number of points.

boardgamehonor.12462: 2005 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee

24692.name: Sapperlot
24692.description:
Ingenuity and vocabulary are required in this game. The players note as many words as possible with a specific letters drawn. But think quickly - then the time runs out....

The game is in German but works just as well in English.

24693.description:
From the Publisher:

"The new game system has the clean play of the designer’s masterpiece, Defiant Russia, and is crafted to fit the nature of combat in 1916. Artillery bombardment and assault combat take place separately. Elite troops have numerous advantages, and morale is a vital component of the game. Game pieces represent regiments and a handful of battalions. Units are rated for morale, attack, defense and movement.
The game is packaged just like Defiant Russia in a small box."

boardgameversion.85662: Avalanche Press First edition in small box

24693.name: They Shall Not Pass: The Battle of Verdun 1916

24694.name: Politiskt korrekt?
24694.description: Politiskt korrekt? is a Swedish game produced by the market liberal think tank Timbro. It is a light hearted trivia card game highlighting economic and political facts combined with a bit of humor.

24695.name: Flickers!
24695.description:
Flickers! is the first game of the Canadian-owned company Eagle Games Ltd. From their website:

Flickers!, the movie trivia game that leaves nothing to chance!

Flickers (slang): a motion picture.

That explains the name of the game. But why do we call it the movie trivia game that leaves nothing to chance? Because in this game, the element of chance has been eliminated. There are no traditional dice to indicate space moves on aboard; there are no exact number requirements to win the game and there are no free rolls of a dice.

The only playing piece is a color-coded cube corresponding to movie categories.

Flickers! is scored, and won, solely on your knowledge of the movies. You score points (or lose them) based on what you know about the movies, from home-grown fare to foreign treats, from the 1930s to the present.

Flickers! has been created and designed to be fun for the casual once-a-month movie goer as well as challenging enough for the avid movie-a-week film buff.

Flickers! can be played by any number of adult players, anytime, anywhere. It can be played by individuals, or in teams. It can be played at the dining-room table, in the park, or in the back seat of a car on a road trip.

And if any of the question and answer cards pique your curiosity, go out and rent the movie. You may have no idea what delights you are missing when you don't explore all the genres from all the decades, and the works of stars past and present.

Above all, enjoy.....the movies and Flickers!

24696.name: Crossfire
24696.description:
Inspired by Sid Sackson's classic abstract Focus, Crossfire is a stacking game played on a hexagonal grid.

Piece stacks have a maximum size dependent on how many neighboring hexes it has. Excess pieces in a stack are removed from the bottom by the stack's controller and either returned to the stack controller's reserve to return to the board later, or else are captured and removed from the game.

A move consists of a player moving either a stack he controls, or pieces from the top of a stack he controls, and then moves those pieces in a straight line a number of spaces up to the number of pieces being moved. Alternatively, a player may introduce a piece from his reserve onto any space on the board.

The game is won when he forces his opponent into a position where his opponent cannot make a move.

Online Play

Boardspace.net (real time, AI option)

24697.name: HexDame
24697.description:
HexDame translates International Draughts onto a hexagonal grid (or, alternatively, onto the vertices' of a triangular grid). Pieces move either straight ahead or in either forward-oblique direction.

Board of HexDame

Game play alternates between player white and player red.
Player white begins.
Players are not allowed to skip a turn.



Objective


A player wins by capturing all opponent's pieces or if the opponent can not perform a legal move on his turn.
On agreement or if the same game situation repeats three times the game is draw.



Moving


Men move forward only. Thus following the algebraic notation of the diagram
red men move either
in direction of smaller numbers or
preceeding letters (alphabetical order) or
both at once, while

white men move either
in direction of higher numbers or
suceeding letters or
both at once.




Sample moves: Red man can move to positions indicated by '#', while white man can move to '+'

Promotion to King


On reaching the rows at the opposite edge of the board at conclusion of a move it promotes to king. This is indicated by stacking a second checker of same color on top.


Red men get promoted when reaching any of the nine positions indicated '#' at conclusion of red's move.
White men get promoted when reaching any of the nine positions indicated '+' at conclusion of white's move.
