Two Pair of shoes run up on each other, heel to point...
With every step the distance between them becomes smaller. Cheating is forbidden! Whoever fits in the last gap wins.

24531.name: Top
24531.description:
More wooden fun from Steffen Spiele.

Top is a fun dexterity game where players try to trap the stick with a paddle before it drops. It sounds easier than it is, and with varying length sticks the challenge gets greater.

24532.name: Fuchsen & Mausen
24532.description: A first - a Steffen-Spiele game made of leather instead of wood! This is a dexterity game where players flick disks of various colored leather to try to reach certain targets.

24533.name: Dumy Rumy
24533.description: DUMY RUMY is a great party game and lots of fun the whole family, too. It combines equal parts of skill and luck, courage and cunning... makes addicts out of players in a single session.

24534.name: Alaska Dyke Life
24534.description:
A limited edition poster/game, with only 400 printed. A roll and move game featuring localities within Alaska. Art/game produced by Anchorage artist Kenna Bates.

Game takes place on a 23" x 34" poster (suitable for framing). Game pieces and dice not included.

The object of the game is to "collect as many girlfriends as you can!". "Girlfriends" = points, which are traded among players as they move onto different spaces.

Proceeds from the print/game are to support athletes participating in the Montreal Out Games.

24535.name: Curious George A B See Game
24535.description: In Curious George A B See Game, four cards playing cards are set in front of the players. The cards are double sided and contain either: (1) different colored letters of the alphabet or (2) different colored objects (purple zebra, green triangle, etc.). A color and letter card are simultaneously flipped over. The players must quickly find either a letter that is in the correct color or an object in the correct color that begins with the chosen letter. If you are the first to identify the combination, you get the letter card. Any player that makes a misidentification loses a card already won. After all 26 letters have been played, the winner is the player with the most cards.

24536.name: Old New Testament
24536.description:
Quiz based card game featuring questions from both the Old and new Testaments.

This game is vol 3 of Ramco's 10 volume set of quiz card games.

Can be combined with other sets for a larger and more diverse game.

Features 52 doubled sized cards containing 3 levels of difficulty (Beginner, Advanced and Master).

24537.name: Burn Out!
24537.description:
Experience for yourself those "Happy Days" of roller skatin' drive in's, rock 'n' roll music, burgers - fries - malts, and best of all...impressin' your best gal and your best pals... just you and your souped-up, tricked out, really boss, totally cool, smmmoookkkinnn'...Hot Rod Car.

The legacy of America's Happy Days of Hot Rod muscle cars lives on as you and your friends run race after thrilling race. A time when 400 H.P. and smokin' tires were the "rules of the Street".

Remember to buckle-up and hang on...you're in for the ride of your life.

24539.name: Stack-A-Derm
24539.description: "The Stack-A-Derm Game, the Precarious Pachyderm Pile Up" has a hand-crafted wooden elephant with a large disk on his back, 80 wooden chips, and a single die. Players take turns placing the wooden chips (number determined by a die roll) on the elephant's back, with each chip not touching the one previously placed. Any chips that fall are given to the player. When all chips have been used, the player with the least chips wins.

24540.name: Flip-Tac-Toe
24540.description:
Stack, slide, and flip your way to 3 in a row!

Players will flip for this strategic twist on traditional tic-tac-toe. The goal remains to get three of your color chips in a row...but now players can stack pieces, move them around, or even flip the stacks over. Just when you think you've got your chips lined up, the game takes a surprising turn! Includes game board, 64 big foam color chips, and guide. Grades 1 and up.

24541.name: TetraTrax
24541.description:
Drop in and win!

"Shape up" strategic thinking skills with TetraTrax. Players slip their puzzle tiles down the rails into the clear tower, and score 1 point for every opposing tile their puzzle tile touches. Watch out, though...you'll lose a point if you leave open spaces in the puzzle. The tension builds as the height of the puzzle grows. Includes game tower with built-in score keeper, 24 game tiles in two colors, and guide. For 2 players.
Grades 1 and up.

24542.name: Wrestling Madness
24542.description:
From the publisher's website:

Wrestling Madness is a wrestling board game for 2-6 players; ages 8 to adult. In an arena where only the toughest survive and the heroes are made of steel, watching is the next best thing to being in the ring. Until now! If you think you have what it takes to join the ranks of Wrestling's very best, then it is time to join the Madness. Wrestling Madness. A wrestling board game where you claw your way through the ranks of the professional wrestling circuit by wrestling tough opponents and earning cash. Travel the mad Wrestling circuit earning money and wrestling your way to the top of the wrestling world. You must earn $100,000 before getting the chance to take on the mad Wrestling Federation's Champion. The first player to defeat this champion is the new mad Wrestling champion of the world and Winner of this exciting wrestling board game.

24543.name: Equazzle
24543.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ages 5+. An educational award winner, Equazzle successfully combines what kids think are total opposites: Math and Fun! The 5 to 8-year-old plays Equazzle using the addition and subtraction side of the board, while the reverse side reinforces multiplication skills and introduces negative numbers to the 8+ set. The playing pieces can be used as a perpetual puzzle for youngsters starting as early as age 3.

24544.name: Sentence Says Dice Edition
24544.description:
From the publisher's website:

Sentence Says Dice Edition is hilarious fun for the entire family to play at home or on the road! Draw an action card and read the sentence instruction. Now roll the letter dice to see what letters you will get to create your sentence. Hurry, the timer's running out! What will your sentence say? For the letters: F, L, S, I and P, how about "Frogs Like Singing In Ponds-" Opponents judge a winning sentence and can steal it if you're not careful! Educational benefits include: sentence structure, critical thinking, oral communication and quick-thinking exercises. For 2-4 players.

24545.name: Split
24545.description: Each of the two players chooses a color from among those on the perimeter of the board shown, and each places one of his tokens (such as black and white Go stones) onto each of the two spaces of his color. Then they alternately place their tokens into vacant spaces, trying to form a connected path between their original perimeter spaces.

24546.name: Moxie
24546.description:
According to the given rules, the pieces, eight on each army, start in reserve off the board. A move consists of either: 1) placing a piece from your reserve on any vacant square; 2) moving a piece to any adjacent square, orthogonally or diagonally (as a chess king), or 3) capturing an enemy piece by jumping it, like an 8-directional checker. Multiple jumps are allowed. When a jump is possible, jumping is compulsory, though the player may choose any jumping move available and need not capture the greatest possible number of pieces.

The object is either to form a line of three of your pieces, orthogonally or diagonally with no intervening spaces, or to capture six enemy pieces (i.e. reduce your enemy’s forces to two so that he cannot win).

24547.name: Mitzvah Match
24547.description: Match the Mitzvah cards and win! No reading required. For 1-4 players ages 4-10.

24548.name: Aleph Bet Adventure
24548.description:
From the Publisher:

Get ready for an exciting adventure! You are going to be whisked off to an animal safari park filled with all your favorite animals and characters. Starting with the first Hebrew letter Aleph and all the way to the last letter Tov, you'll find a friendly group who is ready to help you learn the Hebrew alphabet. This fun and colorful board game provides early exposure to the Hebrew alphabet, and builds important beginning reading skills such as letter recognition, initial sounds, and more. No reading required. Perfect for school or home! For 2-4 players ages 3 and up.

24550.name: What's Your AstroStyle?
24550.description:
From the publisher:

Find your star power with What's Your AstroStyle? -, the game that reveals more than just your sign! AstroStyle is a brand created by the AstroTwins, Tali and Ophi, who are the official astrologers for Teen People Magazine. The Twins also wrote the book "AstroStyle", which gives advice for love, life and looking great. The AstroAngels are here to guide you! How well do you know your friends' hopes and dreams for the future? How well do they know yours? With more than a hundred different questions and hundreds of real-life astrological answers, you'll have plenty of chances to reveal fun secrets about your friends and yourself. There's no limit to how much your star power can shine! What's Your AstroStyle? is a game for 3 to 6 players. It has maximum interactivity every turn. Even during another player's turn, each player is fully involved in the action. Contents include 1 Zodiac Board - Game Board, 120 cards based on Love, Life & Style, 6 AstroAngel Tokens, 6 AstroWheels, 6 Answer Booklets, a Rule Sheet, and Game Die.

24552.name: Great States Junior
24552.description:
From the publisher:

Based on the best selling game, Great States!, this junior version provides the same fun, hurry-up action while introducing young players to the map of the 50 states. Find the shape! Find the picture! Find the name! Kids will have a blast searching the game board to find where things are as they travel along the red, white and blue game path. Even pre-readers can play by matching the objects on the cards to the pictures on the board.

24553.name: Showtime Presents: The Great Cable Challenge
24553.description:
Showtime Presents: the great Cable Challenge. The Exciting New Game That Tests Your Skill (And Luck) As A Cable TV Operator!

OBJECTIVE:

Players take turns rolling a die and moving along the spaces on the board from "Franchise Hearing" to "Launch" then on to "Success" to win the game.

Players landing upon "Cable Break" spaces must draw a cable break card and immediately carry out it's instructions. Some of these are to be used only after "Launch". Upon landing on any of the four red spaces, a player must stop and end his or her turn. At his or her next turn, the direction that the
Player must take will be determined by the roll.

On the last red space on the board a player must stop and then, on each subsequent turn, roll the die continuously until reaching a combined total of 7 or 11. If 11 is exceeded the Player must wait until his or her next turn to try again. The first Player to reach the "Success" circle with no Cable Break Cards in his possession has met the Cable Challenge and wins the Game.

24554.name: Moneywise Kids
24554.description:
from the publisher:

Game Concept: Practice making change while players earn a $100 bill. Then learn to budget money while spending it on life’s necessities, such as housing, food, clothing, etc.

Special Features: Two simple, fast-paced games to improve valuable math skills that kids will use all their lives. Includes facsimiles of real U.S. money. Tips are featured that parents and teachers can use to connect Moneywise Kids play with the real world.

24555.name: Monkey in the Middle
24555.description:
From the publisher:

Monkey in the Middle is a fun skill and action game that lets players take chances with the roll of the dice. With a delightfully illustrated game board, players try to roll their monkey dice into the special "Banana Zone" to earn Banana Scoring Chips. But if you roll too hard one of your monkeys may fall into the middle and be gone! A unique way for little ones to practice counting and grouping and to interact with each other.

24556.name: Quick Pix Animals
24556.description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Animals -- Which group an animal belongs to (reptile, bird, crustacean, etc.)

24557.name: Quick Pix Geography
24557.description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Geography -- in what region of the world (Western Europe, South America, etc.) countries are located

24558.name: Quick Pix Math
24558.description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Math -- Commonly used addition and subtraction facts

24559.name: Quick Pix Multiplication
24559.description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Multiplication -- Commonly used multiplication facts

24560.name: Quick Pix Money
24560.description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Money -- Recognizing and adding different coin values

24561.name: Sci-ology
24561.description:
From the publisher:

An exhilarating science game that uses memory, thinking, and strategy skills! The goal of this exciting game is to collect the most quartets (groups of four) by using memory and strategy skills. At the same time, this fast-paced game introduces players to the different fields of science while learning fun facts provided on each card (such as, "The giant clam can be 4.5 feet tall and weigh 500 pounds"). Sci-ology is a fascinating game that is a blast for the whole family and will be played over and over again for many years to come. Includes: 48 oversized (4"x6") colorful fun fact-filled cards.

24562.name: McWiz: The Ultimate Game of Knowledge and Trivia
24562.description:
From the publisher:

Mc Wiz was created for people who like to learn while having fun and for those who like to have fun while learning. Whether you enjoy serious questions, trivia, word games, proverbs or not-so-serious questions, you'll love Mc Wiz. You are a sports or history buff, you enjoy TV and the silver screen, you like to learn about science and the world, or you're crazy about word games and completing proverbs and expressions, Mc Wiz will give you hours and hours of challenge and enjoyment. You want to learn about chemistry or brush up on your English grammar, practice your Spanish or your French, review your world capitals? Do it while having fun! Mc Wiz is a "Wise Old Owl". He has 4200 questions that are suitable for teens and adults.

24563.name: Typhoons & Turtleships
24563.description: Typhoons & Turtleships. Two player card game simulating the various attempts of the Japanese and the Koreans (Chinese & Mongols too) to conquer each other across the Sea of Japan. Players alternate being the Attacker. If the Attacker wins both the Naval and Conquest phases he wins. Strategy favors the defender, but the attacker only has to win once. Players share a deck. Some cards are specific to a certain player or a certain phase. Good filler game. Educational on an offbeat historical Topic. Complete Rules and link to card set available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TTS.html

24565.description:
A Japanese racing and sports competition game using athletes with special powers. The game is consistent with other games in the Grimpeur series in that it comes in a colorful small box and has modest components.


Game Summary
Players all start with seed money, used to draft a team of racers. The racers come out in random order, and each have a unique power (mostly modifying movement rules, sometimes giving extra pre- or post- race abilities). The draft is as follows: shift any unbought racers down one step on the board (decreasing prices as they shift), then add a new card to the display. If all spaces full, must buy one. After players have their racers (a few will remain out of game), there will be 4 or 5 races. For each race, players secretly simultaneously choose a racer. Then, in turn order, simply roll d6 and move your racer. Of course, special powers modify movement throughout the race.

The first 2 finishers score VP (more VP in later races); most VP after all races wins!
24565.name: Magical Athlete

24566.name: Gimel
24566.description:
Each player has 24 pieces; 8 horus (large cylinders, worth 6 points), 8 bastets (large triangles, worth 3 points) and 8 scarabs (small round buttons, worth 1 point).

The game starts on an empty 8x18 board and a player can either place a new piece on an empty space of the board or move an existing one on the board - depending on it's movement restrictions.

Winner is the player with the most captures, that is not the number of captures, but the total value of the captured pieces.

24567.description:
Astronomical Tables is a 7 player game from Alphonso the Wise's Book of Games ("Libros del Axedrez, Dados et Tablas") produced in the late 13th century.

Astronomical Tables is a form of Backgammon, played on a heptagon shaped board, each side of which is divided into seven spaces. Each player starts with seven pieces all placed in the first space on their side of the board. Players move their pieces around the board (so a total of 49 spaces on the board) trying to eliminate all their opponents. The player who eliminates the most pieces wins (they are also usually the last player left standing, but not always).
24567.name: Astronomical Tables

24568.description:
Rumis+ is both a six-player expansion for Blokus 3D and a stand-alone two-player game. It includes six new boards and blocks in orange and purple.

It is in the 2006 graphic style, and as it is from the Swiss publisher, the pieces are wood, but are the same size as in the plastic US edition from Educational Insights
24568.name: Rumis+

24569.name: Narro
24569.description:
The name of the game is derived from the German word "Narr", which means fool or clown.

The game is played on a 12x12 board. Each player has 3 red, green, blue and yellow playing pieces, but one player uses the round pieces and the other the square ones. Each field of the board shows one of these 4 colors and the pieces can move only on fields of their color.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces and still having 2 or more own pieces on the board. Captures are made by jumping over opposing pieces.

24570.name: Jangala
24570.description:
Jangala is played on a very small board (5x5) with very few playing pieces (3 per player).

You start in one edge with your 3 pieces of different size and must try to reach the opposing edge first to become winner.

Sounds very easy, but that's not true! The problem is that you are only allowed to move on empty fields or on fields with pieces not smaller than yours. Additionally, only the top pieces can move... so it's clear, that bringing your fattie on the other side of the board is really challenging.

24571.name: Polyp
24571.description:
Polyp is a little like Chinese Checkers plus the expansion of polyps, who can capture enemy playing pieces (here called fishes).

Important though, that the game ends finally, when all fishes have either reached their destinations or are captured. So the winner is the one who has most of successful fishes plus captured ones.

Quite unusual are the polyps: they are 5 pieces connected together with a thin metallic chain, which enables to move only 2 fields away from each other polyp part!

24572.name: Kristall
24572.description:
In Crystal 2-6 players try to find some hidden treasures and bring them back to the 2 staring points.

A special die not only lets players move 0-3 fields, it also determines if a treasure is found and if other special features, like the arising of a crystal wall, appear.

A funny aspect are the 4 transparent "glass-witches" which are mainly used to annoy other players. Much luck after all, but nice components anyway.

24574.name: Casino Las Vegas
24574.description:
This game is played on a round-course like Monopoly. You have to draw cards for special events and you can purchase 1 of 6 casinos when landing on their space.

But this is only one part of this game. Every time a player lands of the numerous casino-game spaces, he can "enter" the casino and play poker, craps, Chicago, (mini-)Roulette and blackjack. If the casino belongs to another player, the owner of the casino plays the bank!

Interesting, that the casino card games are played with a 32 skat deck...

24575.name: LOST The Card Game
24575.description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit ABC TV show LOST. You will attempt to play crucial event cards whilst avoiding the 'Others', wild boars and Polar Bears...

To get this game for free, go to the address below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

SPOILER WARNING: This game contains information and pictures from LOST episodes which may not have been screened in some countries; enter at your own risk.

LOST is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.
